Mission 14

Averages

Mission 14: Averages

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A C-Rank Gate has been detected. Difficulty: Statistical Analysis. Hunter, prepare to calculate the Mean of the Data Realm!

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, every elite Hunter tracks their statistics: average damage per strike, mean dungeon clear time, typical loot per raid. The average (also called mean) summarizes many numbers into one powerful statistic.

Today, you'll roll dice and discover what "average" truly means!

‚öîÔ∏è Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - Paper and pencils/markers - Dice (at least 1, preferably 2) - Graph paper - Dice Sums PDF (optional)

üéØ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Mean Calculation - Find the average of a data set (6.SP.3) - Center Understanding - Recognize that average summarizes all values with one number (6.SP.3) - Data Interpretation - Read and create graphs about averages

üìñ The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

What is an Average (Mean)?

The average (or mean) is the sum of all values divided by the count:

Average = Sum of all values √∑ Number of values

Example:
Values: 3, 7, 5, 9, 6
Sum: 3 + 7 + 5 + 9 + 6 = 30
Count: 5 values
Average: 30 √∑ 5 = 6

Mean, Median, Mode, Range

Term Meaning Example (2,3,3,4,8)
Mean Average (2+3+3+4+8)√∑5 = 4
Median Middle value 3 (when sorted)
Mode Most frequent 3 (appears twice)
Range Highest - Lowest 8 - 2 = 6

Why Averages Matter

The average tells you what's "typical" or "expected":

Dice rolls: 2, 5, 4, 7, 2
Average: 20 √∑ 5 = 4

This means on a typical roll, you can expect around 4.
(Even though you can't actually roll a 4 on a standard die!)

Video Lesson: Mean, Median, Mode and Range

üó°Ô∏è The Quest (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

With all of the students view this document: Dice sums. Discuss the questions on the page about the information shown. What do you learn from this graph?

Roll a dice as many times as you want. Keep track of the numbers that you roll. Once you are done, find the sum of the numbers that you rolled. For instance, if you rolled a 2,5,4,7,2, you would add these numbers together which equals 20. Then divide the sum by the amount of times you rolled, which in this case is 5. 20√∑5= 4. Your answer is the average of the numbers that you rolled. It is also called the mean.

Notice that when a 2 was rolled a second time, you still write it down. Is there a number that you rolled more often than the other numbers? If you were to play a game with dice, such as monopoly, or sequence, etc., what number would you have the greatest chance of rolling? Could you graph the outcome of your rolls? What if you rolled more than 5 times, how would that change your average?

After looking at the first graph, which pairs would be the most likely to be rolled when playing a game with 2 dice?

üí° Hunter's Strategy Guide

Phase 1: Roll and Record

Roll the die 10 times. Record each roll:

Roll 1: ___    Roll 6: ___
Roll 2: ___    Roll 7: ___
Roll 3: ___    Roll 8: ___
Roll 4: ___    Roll 9: ___
Roll 5: ___    Roll 10: ___

Phase 2: Calculate the Sum

Example rolls: 3, 5, 2, 6, 4, 1, 3, 5, 2, 4

Sum = 3+5+2+6+4+1+3+5+2+4 = 35

Phase 3: Find the Average

Average = Sum √∑ Count
Average = 35 √∑ 10
Average = 3.5

This means your "typical" roll was about 3.5!

Phase 4: Find the Mode

From our example: 3, 5, 2, 6, 4, 1, 3, 5, 2, 4

Count each number:
1: once
2: twice  ‚Üê Appears most!
3: twice  ‚Üê Appears most!
4: twice  ‚Üê Appears most!
5: twice  ‚Üê Appears most!
6: once

Multiple modes: 2, 3, 4, 5 (all appear twice)

Phase 5: Graph Your Results

Number of times each value appeared:

6 ‚îÇ
5 ‚îÇ
4 ‚îÇ
3 ‚îÇ

    1  2   3   4   5  6

Two-Dice Analysis:

With 2 dice, the most likely sum is 7!

Why? There are 6 ways to roll 7:
1+6, 2+5, 3+4, 4+3, 5+2, 6+1

But only 1 way to roll 2: (1+1)
And only 1 way to roll 12: (6+6)

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 14 about averages and mean.
I need to master mean, median, and mode before my dice assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain the difference between mean, median, and mode
2. Show me how to calculate mean step by step
3. Give me 3 practice problems finding mean (and one finding all three!)
4. Quiz me: "You have 4 tests averaging 85. What do you need on test 5 for a 90 average?"
5. Have me explain when mean vs median is the better measure

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by explaining what "average" actually tells us about data.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

The System awaits your proof, Hunter.

Hunter's Wisdom: The more data you collect, the more reliable your average becomes! If you roll a die 1000 times, your average will be very close to 3.5 (the true expected value). Top Hunters always gather enough data before making decisions!
